Welcome to Contacts API’s documentation!¶

Contacts API main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is configured correctly. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, it raises an HTTPException with status code 500 (Internal Server Error) and detail Database is not configured correctly. If there’s an error connecting to the database, it raises another HTTPException with status code 500 and detail Error connecting to the database;.

Parameters:

db (Session) – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

The returns message: “Welcome to FastAPI!”, if the connection to the database is established, or an exception otherwise is thrown with code 500 and relevant message

Return type:

str | HTTPException

main.read_root() → dict¶

The read_root function returns a dictionary with the key message and value My contacts book. :return: A dictionary with a single key:value pair

async main.startup() → None¶

The startup function is connection of the Redis database

Contacts API repository Auth¶

async contacts.repository.auth.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user that is being confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

async contacts.repository.auth.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Return type:

User

async contacts.repository.auth.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

The first user in the database with the specified email address

Return type:

User | None

async contacts.repository.auth.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶
The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user in the database.
Args:

email (str): The email of the user to update. url (str): The new URL for their avatar image.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Pass in the url of the avatar image

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The user object with the updated avatar url

Return type:

User

async contacts.repository.auth.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

Contacts API repository Contacts¶

async contacts.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Create a new contact object

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A contact object

Return type:

Contact

async contacts.repository.contacts.delete_contact(user_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the contact to be deleted. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

The deleted contact (if it exists) or none

Return type:

Contact | None

async contacts.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(user_email: str, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶
The get_contact_by_email function takes in a user_email and returns the contact associated with that email.

If no such contact exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • user_email – str: Pass the email of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

Returns:

A contact object

Return type:

Contact | None

async contacts.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Contact | None¶
The get_contact_by_id function takes in a contact_id and returns the corresponding Contact object.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. db (Session): A database session to query for the desired Contact object. user (User): The current user, used to ensure that only contacts belonging to this user are returned.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that you want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Return type:

Contact | None

async contacts.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session, user: User) → list[contacts.database.models.Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the starting point for the query

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Return type:

list[Contact]

async contacts.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthday(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session, user: User) → list[contacts.database.models.Contact]¶
The get_contacts_by_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next 7 days.

The function takes in 3 parameters: limit, offset, and db. Limit is an integer representing how many contacts to return at once. Offset is an integer representing where to start returning results from (i.e., if you want to get the second page of results). Db is a database session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Set the maximum number of contacts that can be returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return rows

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days

Return type:

list[UserContact]

async contacts.repository.contacts.get_search_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session, user: User, contact_first_name: str | None = None, contact_last_name: str | None = None) → list[contacts.database.models.Contact]¶
The get_search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

It takes a limit and offset to paginate through results, as well as a user object to identify which user’s contacts are being searched. The function also takes optional contact_first_name and contact_last_name arguments that can be used to filter the search results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of rows to skip

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • contact_first_name – str | None: Filter the contacts by first name

  • contact_last_name – str | None: Filter the contacts by last name

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Return type:

list[Contact]

async contacts.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user: User) → Contact¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is to be deleted

  • body – ContactModel: Get the information from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is only able to delete their own contacts

Returns:

A contact object

Return type:

Contact

Contacts API routes Auth¶

async contacts.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it gets the user from our database using their email address and checks if they exist. If they don’t exist, we return an error message saying &quot;Verification error&quot;. If they do exist, we check if their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, then we return a message saying &quot;Your email is already confirmed&quot;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Return type:

dict | HTTPException

async contacts.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict | HTTPException¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make authenticated requests on behalf of that user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with the access token and refresh token

Return type:

dict | HTTPException

async contacts.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict | HTTPException¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access token, a new refresh token, and the type of authentication being used.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the new access token, refresh token and the bearer type

Return type:

dict | HTTPException

async contacts.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶
The request_email function is used to send a confirmation email to the user.

The function takes in an email address and sends a confirmation link to that address. If the user’s account has already been confirmed, then they will be notified of this fact.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Return type:

dict | HTTPException

async contacts.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict | HTTPException¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input and returns an HTTP response with the newly created user’s information. If there is already an account associated with that email, it will return a 409 Conflict error.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user’s email and password

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the user and a detail message

Return type:

User | HTTPException

Contacts API routes Contacts¶

async contacts.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

Return type:

Contact

async contacts.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → None¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be deleted, and returns None if successful.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The removed None, or HTTPException if it does not exist.

Return type:

None | HTTPException

async contacts.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact | None¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that will be used to retrieve a specific contact

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object or none

Return type:

Contact | None

async contacts.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(5), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → list[contacts.database.models.Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset contacts

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – Contact : Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Return type:

list[Contact ]

async contacts.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthday(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → list[contacts.database.models.Contact]¶

The get_contacts_by_birthday function returns a list of contacts sorted by birthday.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts

Return type:

list[Contact]

async contacts.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_email(contact_email: EmailStr, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact | None¶

The get_contacts_by_email function returns a contact by email.

Parameters:

  • contact_email – EmailStr: Get the contact email from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object or none if the contact is not found

Return type:

Contact | None

async contacts.routes.contacts.get_search_contacts(limit: int = 10, offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_first_name: str | None = None, contact_last_name: str | None = None) → list[contacts.database.models.Contact]¶
The get_search_contacts function is used to search for contacts in the database.

The user can enter a contact_first_name and/or a contact_last_name, which will be searched for in the database. If no name is entered, all contacts are returned.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • contact_first_name (str | None) – contact name

  • contact_last_name (str | None) – contact surname

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async contacts.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact_id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Return type:

Contact | None

Contacts API routes Users_Avatar¶

async contacts.routes.users_avatar.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶

The read_users_me function returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Return type:

User

async contacts.routes.users_avatar.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded by the client. It also takes in the current_user and db objects as dependencies.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated user object

Return type:

User

Contacts API service Auth¶

class contacts.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

class for user verification

Methods: verify_password, get_password_hash, create_access_token, create_refresh_token, decode_refresh_token, get_current_user, get_email_from_token, create_email_token

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, from now that this token should expire. If not specified, it will default to 30 minutes from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data to be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

An encoded access token

create_email_token(data: dict) → str¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp).

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded using the jwt library

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which is 7 days from creation date.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A string encoded token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → EmailStr¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If it fails, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that was sent to the client

Returns:

EmailStr | HTTPException: email or Exception message

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

User | HTTPException: user or Exception message

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → EmailStr¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from its payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Decode the token and get the email address from it

Returns:

EmailStr | HTTPException: email or Exception message

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object’s hash method, which uses bcrypt to generate a secure hash.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Take in the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method work for a specific instance of the class

  • plain_password – str: Check if the password entered by the user matches the hashed_password

  • hashed_password – str: Check if the password is correct

Returns:

A boolean value

Contacts API service Email¶

async contacts.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str) → None¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that users can click on within their emails.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Pass the email address of the user to email

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be sent an email

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

None | ConnectionErrors: None or print Error message
